alert.note: Alert for Howard; Sevier (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued March 17 at 2:22PM CDT until March 18 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Freeze Warning, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 31 degrees expected Saturday morning. For the Freeze Watch, sub-freezing temperatures as low as 24 degrees possible Sunday morning. * WHERE...In Arkansas, Sevier County and Howard County. In Oklahoma, McCurtain County. * WHEN...For the Freeze Warning, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CDT Saturday. For the Freeze Watch, from late Saturday night through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
